Mammillary body.EditorialNote: Brain Info/Neuronames lists the mammillary body as a superficial feature of the posterior hypothalamus.  However, the MSH definition clearly indicates that it is the nuclei that it refers to.  Needs review.
Mammillary body.Definition: One of two hemispherical bulges on the base of the posterior hypothalamus (Butler and Hodos, Comparative Vertebrate Neuroanatomy, 2nd ed., 2005, pg 455).
